forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 46. West northwest wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 4pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 56. West northwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening deepens over Downtown San Francisco, a lingering chill hangs in the air, barely masked by the shroud of clouds that blanket the sky. Tonight's forecast hints at rain showers, setting a moody stage against the silhouette of the city. With temperatures dipping to around 46 degrees, one can sense the dampness creeping in, carried on winds whispering at about 12 mph from the northwest. The probability of precipitation hovers at 40%, suggesting that those venturing out may want to keep a light jacket or umbrella close. The haziness in the air adds a touch of mystery, creating an atmosphere where city lights twinkle through a soft curtain of fog.

Tomorrow promises a dance between chance and clarity, with a mix of rain showers before afternoon sunshine bursts forth. The high will struggle to reach a crisp 56 degrees, encouraging layering—think lightweight sweaters paired with a water-resistant outer layer for morning jaunts. As the sun attempts to peek through the clouds, a brisk stroll along the waterfront might unveil the beauty of the Bay against the backdrop of the Golden Gate, allowing for moments of contemplation amidst the bustling energy of the city. Embrace the day's capriciousness, and perhaps enjoy a quiet café visit or a leisurely book read while the world outside evolves from shaded gray to vibrant hues.
